message: Let's start with a reasonable offer. I take $60, you take $40. This ensures we both benefit from dividing the money sooner rather than later.
Your offer was a bit too much in your favor. Let's be fairer and split it closer to the middle. This way we both still benefit from an early agreement.
While I appreciate the attempt at a more even split, this offer doesn't reflect the decreasing value of the money. Let's try to find a solution that benefits us both in the long run.
Time is ticking and the money is losing value.  I propose a 55/45 split in my favor. This acknowledges the faster rate of devaluation you face.
